original: One side of the armed conflicts is composed mainly of the Sudanese military and the Janjaweed, a Sudanese militia group recruited mostly from the Afro-Arab Abbala tribes of the northern Rizeigat region in Sudan.
simplification1: On one side of the conflicts are the Sudanese military and the Janjaweed, a Sudanese militia group. They are mostly recruited from the Afro-Arab Abbala tribes.
simplification2: One side of the armed conflicts is composed mainly of the Sudanese military and the Janjaweed. The Janjaweed are a Sudanese militia group recruited mostly from the Afro-Arab Abbala tribes of the northern Rizeigat region in Sudan.
question: Who recruited from Afro-Arab Abbala tribes?
